intro: Melanocenchris abyssinica, commonly known as the Abyssinian star-of-Bethlem, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. The plant has a woody stem and produces small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to the arid conditions of its native region. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
